p: A total of 308 individuals were included in the study during the years 2018 and 2019, following established inclusion and exclusion criteria, selected for convenience, representing approximately 2.24% of 13,758 patients where there was an initial suspicion of malaria. Serum samples were collected from each participant, as well as the clinical data needed for the study. All 308 patients had a negative result in the Plasmodium sp. 65.6% (202/308) of the patients were male and 34.4% (106/308) were female. All individuals seen had an acute febrile condition with onset of symptoms ranging from 1 to 5 days prior to the date of the consult.
